Here is my opinion on making streams better, which partly borrows/shares some ideas others have mentioned.

  • Move "Home" above the divider, next to the icon.
  • Move "Private Messages" to the right sidebar.
  • Get "Starred messages" and "@-mentions" out of the left sidebar, probably by moving them to the right sidebar as well, since they're both sort of "personal" in some sense.
  • Automatically put streams with unread messages above a divider (but probably still below pinned streams).
  • Have the search bar open by default if you have >= N streams.

For PMs I strongly agree on a couple earlier points:

  • We should have the "Private messages" closer to the buddy list, and probably open by default (for at least the 5 most recent conversations).
  • All the inactive users are pure clutter to me. (They are important for really new, small realms, but we can accommodate that use case.)

I don't have a strong opinion on the "GROUP PMs" widget. I wouldn't miss it too much if we eliminated it or further de-emphasized it somehow.
Agree, 100%. The group PMs widget will not be needed since the user list will be mixed with group pms. Just the availability status circle needs to be added to users you've chatted with.

I have a few thoughts on these ideas:

  • I think everyone agrees the "Group PMs" widget should go; it exists only because group PMs didn't used to be in "Private messages" at all.
  • Active vs. inactive is quite useful in organizations with a lot of streams, because it means that you don't suffer any material inconvenience from being subscribed to an extra stream that is dormant right now (but might start having traffic again later).
  • I agree that it'd be really good to have "private messages" default-expanded at least to a few threads, and to not have the duplication of "private messages" with the user list in the right sidebar. But I have some concerns about moving private messages and mentions to the right sidebar that I think are worth talking about:
    • If the page is too narrow to fit both sidebars, right now the experience is pretty reasonable, because the left sidebar has everything important and needed to account for all the unread messages. We'd need to think carefully about how to make the experience still feel good if we moved those to the right sidebar. For that reason, I'd also not be excited about moving mentions and starred messages over. I think a potentially valid approach would be in that responsive mode to try to fit both the sidebars' content in the left side, either with a tab switcher or with them stacked above each other.
    • It's nice that one can catch up on all unread messages entirely looking at the left sidebar area, rather than having to look back and forth across the screen.
  • Rishi and I chatted a bit yesterday about Steve's idea of sorting unread streams in the left sidebar to the top, below pinned streams. A concern that came up is that doing so could make it hard to find a stream you're looking for when scanning the list (if your immediate goal is to open that stream and send a message to it, not to catch up on unread messages). Also, it would mean that the streams list re-sorts quite frequently when new messages come in, which might not look great and could be annoying when you're trying to click on a specific stream to have it potentially move on you.

It would be nice to reduce the real estate taken up by those three, and IMHO the only tricky UI problem is how to make it easy to scan those for unread counts. Of the three, it's really only @-mentions where you want to see the unread counts, because when you come from lunch, you may want to go there first. (Starred messages are already read, and Home-unread-counts are important, but they don't need to be jumping out at you.)

Going back to "my" idea of moving unread counts to the top, I should mention that Boris actually brought this up first, so it's a problem that resonates with at least two users.   • Just be way more aggressive in what we consider "inactive" for a stream.
  • Add a toggle widget to hide the unreads.

Thinking about the new user experience, I think there's a bit of an issue in the left sidebar where we heavily prioritize (visually) the wrong part of the product. In particular, we have "All messages", "Private messages" etc where a mail product might have "Inbox", and in practice, "All messages" is the first thing people click on when they're trying out Zulip. This is a bad experience for many reasons, among them

  • It's not the intended way to use Zulip
  • The All messages view is visually unappealing, and is probably the hardest screen of the product to fix (visually)
  • The All messages view is kind of overwhelming
